lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

* Represent a parser class that handles user commands.
* An enum to store the specific commands which the user can use.
* Read user input to return a command to be executed.
* @param ui Ui object to interact with user.
* @param taskList TaskList object that records the task.
* @param storage Storage object that saves and loads information.
* @return Command A specific command to execute a certain action.
public static Command parse(String input, Ui ui, TaskList taskList, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
return new DeleteCommand(ui, taskList, storage, Integer.parseInt(inputs[inputs.length - 1]));
return new MarkDoneCommand(ui, taskList, storage, Integer.parseInt(inputs[inputs.length - 1]));
return new MarkUndoneCommand(ui, taskList, storage, Integer.parseInt(inputs[inputs.length - 1]));
return new CreateTodoCommand(ui, taskList, storage, input);
return new CreateEventCommand(ui, taskList, storage, input);
return new CreateDeadlineCommand(ui, taskList, storage, input);
return new FindCommand(ui, taskList, storage, input);
return new ErrorCommand(ui, taskList, storage, "Please use the correct command Word!>.<");
return new ErrorCommand(ui, taskList, storage, "Please use the correct command Word!>.<");
* Represent a Storage class that saves and loads information.
* @param filepath The filepath to the file that contains recorded tasks.
assert filepath != null : "filepath should not be null!";
* Load the taskList from the filePath.
* @return TaskList The TaskList object to be loaded from the filePath.
* Save the taskList object into the filePath.
* @param taskList The TaskList object to be saved.
public void save(TaskList taskList) throws IOException {

* Set task as not done in the TaskList.
* @param index Index of task to be set as not done.

* Prints error message to the user.

* Abstract method to perform action for a command.
* @throws  DukeException throws an exception when error arise in execute.
public abstract String execute() throws DukeException;
* Abstract method to check if command is exit command.
* @return boolean whether command is the exit command.
* Get the task name of the task.
* @param commandWord The command word of the input.
* @return String The name of the task.
* @throws DukeException throws an exception when input or commandWord is not valid.
public static String getTaskName(String commandWord, String input) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Please enter a task name for Duke.Tasks.Todo!! >.<");
throw new DukeException("Please enter a task name for Duke.Tasks.Deadline!! >.<");
throw new DukeException("Please enter a task name for Duke.Tasks.Event!! >.<");
throw new DukeException("Please use one of the 3 tasks!! >.<");
* Get the starting date of the task.
* @return String The start date of the task.
* @throws DukeException throws an exception when input is not valid.
public static String getStartDate(String input) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Please use the keyword /from for your event! >.<");
throw new DukeException("Please enter a start date for your event! >.<");
throw new DukeException("Please use the keyword /to for your event! >.<");
throw new DukeException("Please enter an end date for your event! >.<");
* Get the ending date of the task.

public static String getEndDate(String task, String input) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException(String.format("Please enter an end date for your %s!", task));
* Represents a command to create a deadline task.
* @param ui The Ui object to interact with user.
* @param taskList The taskList object to record the tasks.
* @param storage The Storage object to save and load information.
public CreateDeadlineCommand(Ui ui, TaskList taskList, Storage storage, String input) {
addedTask = new Deadline(getTaskName(commandWord, this.input), getEndDate(commandWord, input));
return this.ui.printDateErrorMessage("Please follow the format for date and time (d/M/yyyy HHmm).");

* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
* @param ui The Ui object to interact with user.
* @param taskList The taskList object to record the tasks.
* @param storage The Storage object to save and load information.
* @param indexToMark The index of task to be mark done.
public MarkDoneCommand(Ui ui, TaskList taskList, Storage storage, int indexToMark) {
assert indexToMark > 1 : "index to mark should not be less than 1";
assert indexToMark <= taskList.size() : "index to mark should not be greater than list size";
throw new DukeException("Invalid task number entered.");
* Represents a command to mark a task as not done.

public MarkUndoneCommand(Ui ui, TaskList taskList, Storage storage, int indexToUnmark) {
assert indexToUnmark > 1 : "index to unmark should not be less than 1";
assert indexToUnmark <= taskList.size() : "index to unmark should not be greater than list size";
throw new DukeException("Invalid task number entered.");
